text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The candidate answer explicitly states that the English court's power to grant a freezing injunction in this context is legitimate only because the relief is granted 'in support of arbitral proceedings' (referencing s.44 Arbitration Act 1996) and that the court will only keep the injunction if it is justified and \u201cin aid of\u201d the arbitration rather than an attempt to litigate the merits in England. This directly addresses the core requirement of the criterion: explaining that the injunction's function must be to preserve assets to ensure the enforceability of a future arbitral award.", "criterion_id": "d39c2db7-4452-45f6-a351-13a7da2c4632"}
